title: On subscription creation screen 'OS Image' drop-down list is empty
content:
You export the Microsoft Azure design from CSA version 4.92 and then import it to HCMX. If you create a subscription from the imported Azure design, the OS Image drop-down list is empty.

Cause

The Azure design file Ms-Azure-Images-17.9.0.jsp contains unsupported configurations.

Solution

  1. From CSA, export the design SERVICE_DESIGN_Microsoft_Azure_Compute_<version>.zip to the local file system and extract the contents.
  2. Copy the Ms-Azure-Images-17.9.0.jsp file in the extracted folder to a temporary location and then edit the file to remove the following lines:
    String adminuseridentifier = CSAReadResourceOfferingProperty.getUserIdentifier("admin");
    CSAIntegrationHelper.executeCSAREST("csa/rest/catalog?userIdentifier=" + adminuseridentifier);
    Note that, the custom designs in the CSA environment shouldn't contain these lines. Make sure you remove these lines, before importing any custom designs. 
  3. After editing, rename the file to Ms-Azure-Images-17.9.0-modified.jsp.
  4. Copy the file Ms-Azure-Images-17.9.0-modified.jsp to the following location
    <Global_Nfs_Vol>/data/dnd/<Tenant_Id>/sync/app-server/deployments/csa.war/propertysources/
  5. Import the design from the downloaded zip file. If in published state, unpublish it.
  6. In the service designer, go to the Configuration Options.
  7. Select MS Azure and click option to navigate to the option set.
  8. Select Configurations and then from the Configurations panel, click Select OS Image.
  9. In the Edit Properties panel, from the list items, select Ms-Azure-Images-17.9.0-modified.jsp file and click Done.
  10. Save the changes and then publish the design.
